alert.note: Alert for Glades (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:13PM EDT until October 03 at 2:10PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Miami FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Fisheating Creek near Palmdale affecting Glades County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding remains possible. * WHERE...Fisheating Creek near Palmdale. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Fisheating creek is coming out of flood stage. Access road to campground and the bath house are still Flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.2 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 09/12/1940. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EDT.
